results.title: Executive Assistant
results.description:
** NOTE: Applications can only be accepted through our website at https://gideon300.breezy.hr **

Gideon300 is a high-impact public relations agency representing leaders who stand for America's founding principles.

We are looking for a mission and detail-driven Executive Assistant excited about the opportunity to assist an elite PR company in its operations. The role and the company is 100% remote with great potential for growth.

ABOUT US

Our founder, Matthew Faraci, is a well-known entrepreneur, producer, public relations expert, former political strategist and former TV host.

Faraci has been involved in a number of high-profile, successful ventures including his previous role as Executive Producer of The Chosen—the #1 crowdfunded media project in history—as a producer on the animated kids TV series The Tuttle Twins, as host, for two seasons, of his own TV series on Dove Channel, and most importantly, as founder of the highly-respected public relations agency Inspire Buzz...and now a growing sister agency called Gideon300.

His PR agencies have successfully represented cause-driven clients ranging from popular startups to Fortune 100 companies who have appeared in top media outlets including Newsmax, Fox News, The Washington Times, The Daily Wire, TBN's Huckabee, Glenn Beck, The Epoch Times, Christian Broadcasting Network, The Eric Metaxas Show, Salem Radio Networks, and so many others.

Our clients are demanding and the conservative media world is fast-paced, but we are full of energy and have a passion for the work we do. In this work, we strive for excellence, not perfection and value each team member's contribution.

THE POSITION

The EXECUTIVE ASSISTANT plays a key support role to the president of an elite PR company working with C-Suite clients in a fast paced environment where work priorities can change frequently, but in the end the work must get done. Responsible for supporting the operational effectiveness of the company, including scheduling, data entry, compiling reports, research and ensuring accuracy of all appointments. The successful EA will strategically coordinate the president's schedules, projects, and meetings to maximize his focus on top level matters. This position reports directly to the PRESIDENT of the company.

Responsibilities (including, but not limited to):

  • Scheduling for C-Suite clients and media outlets
  • Calendar management with a focus on keeping team current on the status of media appearances & interviews
  • Managing media lists and data entry within multiple platforms
  • Expense reporting
  • Event coordination and planning
  • Coordinating travel arrangements
  • Working closely with the president to streamline company processes and procedures

Requirements

  • 3 years experience and college degree
  • Polished and articulate phone and email communications skills
  • Tech savvy, with CRM management and remote working experience
  • Strong scheduling skills with unflappable demeanor
  • Exceptional multitasking and organizational skills, with high attention to detail
  • Proficient in Google Suite for calendar, email and document drive
  • Exercising professionalism under deadline pressure and ability to cross-team collaborate
  • High level of confidentiality and discretion
  • Must be able to work a flexible schedule in accordance with the media cycle (based on Eastern Seaboard). Can include early mornings, some late evenings and the occasional weekend

results.title: Senior Account Manager
results.description:
Telco Experts Senior Account Manager Job Description

Telco Experts is a Voice and Data Telecommunications provider as well as a full-service consulting firm serving the business community with a passion for connecting people with what matters with integrity and compassion. The team of 20 employees are based out of 110 Wall Street in New York, NY and are mostly remote.

Position Summary

We are looking for a Senior Account Manager who will be able to think strategically, roll up their sleeves and dig into the data but also able to zoom out and work with the customer on the big picture as well. You will own relationships with our top customers and collaborate cross-functionally with the team to ensure our customers consistently receive first-class service. Our ideal candidate is passionate about using analytical skills to identify problems, find solutions, and improve relationships.

This position can be fully remote (preferable that you are in Central or Eastern time zone) and will pay a competitive salary ($70-80k) and a wide array of benefits including medical benefits and 401k matching programs. The position will start ASAP.

Objectives of this Role

  • Own overall relationship with assigned clients, which includes managing on-boarding, implementation, training, increasing adoption, ensuring retention, and high levels of customer satisfaction
  • Establish a trusted and strategic advisor relationship to help drive continued value of our products and services
  • Maintain and develop customer success strategies and best practices, as well as customer support content
  • Communicate effectively with both internal and external senior-level management to understand customer needs, maximize retention and growth, and communicate learnings
  • Maintain existing customer success metrics and data as directed

Daily and Monthly Responsibilities

  • Serve as day-to-day contact for assigned accounts, building trust and rapport while identifying areas of opportunity, highlighting best practices, and documenting them
  • Review the customer journey, identifying how it's supported, taking a consultative approach in helping clients overcome issues and achieve goals
  • Plan and lead quarterly strategic business reviews with our top customers
  • Collaborate, problem solve, and/or strategize upcoming client meetings with team members
  • Prepare necessary documentation or visuals for client to demonstrate performance of campaigns; analyze trends in CNPS scores to identify areas of improvement
  • Identify cross-sell opportunities within the base by analyzing customer data
  • Work with the sales team to drill customer references and develop case studies

Required Skills and Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree
  • 2+ years of experience in sales, account management, or customer success
  • Strong verbal and written communication, strategic planning, and project management skills
  • Analytical and process-oriented mindset; organized
  • Comfortable working across multiple departments in a deadline-driven environment
  • Active team player, self-starter, and multitasker who can quickly adjust priorities
  • Energized by a high-growth environment and opportunity for increased responsibility
  • Spirit of continuous improvement to implement new processes
  • Experience with CRM (Hubspot experience a plus)
  • Proficient with Microsoft Office Applications with strong Excel skills
  • Telecom experience preferred

results.title: Product and Design Lead
results.description:
About Burq

Burq started with an ambitious mission: how can we turn the complex process of offering delivery into a simple turnkey solution.

We started with building the largest network of delivery networks, partnering with some of the biggest delivery companies. We then made it extremely easy for businesses to plug into our network and start offering delivery to their customers. Now, we’re powering deliveries for some of the fastest-growing companies from retailers to startups.

It’s a big mission and now we want you to join us to make it even bigger! 🚀

We’re already backed by some of the Valley's leading venture capitalists, including Village Global, the fund whose investors include Bill Gates, Jeff Bezos, Mark Zuckerberg, Reid Hoffman, and Sara Blakely. We have assembled a world-class team all over the U.S.

We operate at scale, but we're still a small team relative to the opportunity. We have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to grow while doing the most important work of your career.

We want people who are unafraid to be wrong and support decisions with numbers and narrative. Here’s a quick overview of what you will be doing:


Product Manager

As the Product Lead at Burq, you will work closely with co-founders, technical, and functional teams to manage the process of transforming feedback and ideas into concrete features and product enhancements in our existing platform. You will help to strategically continue building our product roadmap, identify gaps, utilize customer feedback, scope out features, and own the UI/UX design of our platform. You will be part of an emerging team that is helping our clients optimize their delivery operations, and have an immediate impact as the first employee dedicated to this function at a fast-growing, early-stage startup.

What You'll Do

    • Be one of the first 20 people in a growing company on an amazing team
    • Work closely with leadership and engineering to build out the product roadmap, set goals, and execute on project plans
    • Manage the delivery of new features from end to end, start from defining the problem through shipping and measuring success
    • Align with leadership and marketing functions to ensure new features are shared with and adopted by existing customers
    • Define visual UI for mobile and web. Focusing on UI, product branding, and content presentation.
    • Lead the initiative on UX and visual design to help evolve the design of our applications.
    • Rapidly create multiple solutions with sketches, prototypes, and wireframes.
    • Communicate designs and specifications in a reproducible/scalable manner.
    • Spend time talking to customers and analyzing feedback to inform product decisions
    • Play a key role in providing our customers with the best experience possible!

Requirements

Who You Are

  • 3+ years of experience in a product management role (bonus for product-led SaaS company experience)
  • Background working across engineering, design, customer success, and sales
  • Past experience communicating with customers to gather data about pain-points, and communicating that data with key stakeholders to evaluate against the product roadmap
  • Passion for running experiments, and using data-driven approaches to measure and track success
  • Experience writing PRDs and working with engineering teams to scope and workload balance
  • Prior experience with owning UI/UX design
  • An online portfolio featuring your web application, mobile, and any other relevant work.
  • Expert eye to detail for outstanding creative and visual design.
  • Have a go-getter attitude and thrive in the startup environment - you are not shy to experiment with new concepts and use data to validate success
  • Experience using JIRA, agile project management methodologies, and product management software
  • Are highly organized and able to adapt to changing priorities
  • Are a skilled listener & with excellent verbal and written communications

Benefits

About the Team

Owners: We hire a smaller number of high-quality, talented individuals and trust their judgment.

Builders: We are a very early-stage startup, which means there is an endless amount of opportunity to build! We value transparency and cross-collaboration when trying out new strategies, testing new ideas, and giving/receiving feedback.

Velocity: We move fast and with intention. We believe in transparency across our team in order to maintain our velocity and ensure we are not losing focus on the company. mission and vision

Long-Term Thinking: As a small startup, there are endless opportunities that we can tackle in our industry. To ensure we effectively scale and continue to be a market leader, we keep our team focused on our critical initiatives, and provide every team member with full-autonomy over their work in order to meet our long-term goals.

Benefits: We believe in investing heavily in our employees, and provide the below benefits to our team members:

  • Competitive compensation packages, including salary and equity options
  • Remote-First work environment
  • Medical, Dental, Vision insurance
  • Learning and Development Stipend
  • Work-from-home Stipend
  • Generous PTO

Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion: At Burq, we value diversity and take providing our diverse workforce with an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive. We are an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, martial status, veteran status, or disability status.

results.title: Community Manager (Web3 Innovation)

results.title: QA Technical Support Specialist
results.description:
QA Technical Support Specialist

The Quality Assurance (QA) Specialist is a new role expected to build a first-in-class service that fuels innovation by enabling the delivery of high-quality, reliable software and platforms for our client's customized projects. You'll be responsible for building and executing QA plans involving applications of VR, AR and future hardware platforms. You will work with the development teams to analyze and report on defects and performance, and triage feedback for responses. You will also analyze user sentiment in partnership with multiple product groups to identify improvements to our custom solutions and projects.

The ideal candidate is a detail-oriented tech enthusiast with experience working with software development teams shipping great software running on consumer electronics products and utilizing user insights to improve product iterations. You are methodical, a self-starter, meticulous about quality and have a user-oriented mindset. A successful QA Technical Support Specialist will develop and maintain healthy relationships with team members, customers, and internal stakeholders. They will also be an internal expert on adopting upcoming technology and identifying test parameters to assure reliability and usability in an enterprise setting.

Minimum Qualifications

  • 5+ years testing experience on VR, AR, or current game consoles and a resulting strong understanding of the software test process with products utilizing 3D graphics
  • Experience creating/updating application Test Plans and User Acceptance Tests
  • 3+ years of hands-on experience analyzing and interpreting data, drawing conclusions, defining recommended actions, and reporting results across stakeholders
  • Experience going through a full product lifecycle, integrating customer feedback into product requirements, driving prioritization and pre/post-launch execution

Responsibilities

  • Implement process changes to implement and scale QA and testing efforts across multiple products & teams
  • Partner with internal first-party product development teams, develop and execute both small to large-scale beta testing and dogfooding programs that provide coverage for multiple platforms
  • Funnel learnings back to the development teams in a consistent and digestible manner to continuously improve products
  • Partner with QA test teams to integrate learnings into structured test strategies and execution
  • Identify, test, track and report KPI and user-experience trends over the course of the projects
  • Diagnose issues, report defects, and propose A/B tests to discover reoccurrences
  • Establish and implement group-wide defect tracking and reporting system
  • Work with engineers and project leads to triage and prioritize issues for resolution
  • Own the process of creating metrics to measure and monitor product performance
  • Frequently identify significant product, organizational, and process opportunities and drive them to fruition often without explicit direction and resourcing
  • Maximize efficiency in a constantly evolving environment where the process is fluid and creative solutions are the norm

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience building or leading a dogfooding-service for first party products
  • Scripting or coding experience
  • Experience with XR: Virtual Reality, Augmented Reality, Mixed Reality or Spatial Computing technology
  • Experience building a service from scratch

About Elevate

Elevate is a global event staffing agency that connects people with brands. Elevate is an Equal Opportunity Employer, we are committed to discovering and developing diverse talent from every background to create, build, and nurture inclusive teams. This position includes health benefits, 401K, vacation and sick days, and growth opportunities!

Job Type: Full-time/Salaried

Job Location: Remote with PST core working hours

results.title: Software Engineer (DevOps)
results.description:
About Remedy Robotics

Cardiovascular disease is the #1 cause of morbidity and mortality in the world. Much of this could be prevented with better access to specialist care. Take stroke as an example: any delay in treatment can lead to permanent disability or death. However, due to a lack of specialist surgeons, the most effective intervention can only be performed in 2% of US hospitals. For patients who present to one of the 98% of hospitals that do not offer the surgery, treatment is either significantly delayed or not offered at all because timely transfer is not feasible.

Our mission is to bring state-of-the-art vascular intervention to anyone, anytime, regardless of their location. Our team of medical clinicians, roboticists, and machine learning experts are working to bridge this gap by building the world’s first remotely-operated, semi-autonomous endovascular surgical robot.

We’ve already done what nobody else could—using our system, doctors from around the world were able to remotely perform this procedure from as far as 8000 miles away. We now need your help to bring this technology out of the laboratory and into hospitals everywhere.

 

The Role

We’re looking for someone to amplify the engineering organization and develop processes to help build a modern surgical robot. You will work closely with several departments across the company, including machine learning, data, and middleware.

 

Responsibilities

  • Develop a robust CI pipeline with both cloud-based and on-premise, hardware-connected components, for a diverse set of software including robotics, ML, and UI

  • Work with engineers across the organization to find and root out inefficiencies in the development cycle

  • Improve tooling and tracking, such as unit testing and static analysis

  • Standardize and harden on-premise and cloud security

  • Maintain lab/office and cloud-based network infrastructure

     

Requirements

  • 2+ years DevOps or related experience

  • Been responsible for complex CI/CD systems

  • Strong coding abilities

  • Exposure to cloud-based infrastructure such as AWS

     

Nice To Have

  • Experience with Python, C++, and TypeScript

  • Worked with Jenkins or GitHub Actions for CI

  • Familiarity with the Bazel build system

  • Experience maintaining / building / packaging internal software libraries

  • Experience with CI and deployment of web applications

  • Familiarity with Docker

results.title: Product Manager
results.description:
About Us

Amper is a rapidly-growing IoT startup that helps manufacturers unleash their potential with modern software to run operations.

We build a simple but powerful platform that helps manufacturers reduce costs, increase visibility, and drive efficiency. We believe in keeping things simple and easy-to-understand - and our culture and products are a reflection of that. For example, it takes a few minutes to self-install Amper on any kind of industrial machine - like a consumer device and without the traditional hassle of integration.

Our vision is to build the market-leading FactoryOS to enable cutting-edge operations, and we are investing in the next level of growth across our GTM and product teams. We are a venture-backed startup with a distributed team and HQ in Chicago.

About You

We’re growing our product organization and are looking for a Product Manager to help us evolve through our next stage of growth.

Being a Product Manager at Amper means working across every function; Engineering, Sales, Customer Success, Marketing. You’ll work directly with customers to understand what holds them back from achieving their goals and what’s making them successful. You’ll work with engineers to solve problems, sales to find new opportunities for growth, customer-facing teams to process customer feedback, etc. You’ll say “no” a lot.

You’ll enjoy working at Amper if you:

  • Have a strong appetite for the unfamiliar; that includes technical content as well as solving problems our customers face

  • Believe that being helpful and humble are just as important as technical know-how

  • Can teach the things you know well, and acknowledge what you can learn from others

Requirements

  • Outstanding written and verbal communication skills + experience driving influence across functions. Create Marketing and Product Requirement Docs.

  • Project Management.

  • Ready to wear many hats, frequently change contexts

  • High EQ + empathy

  • Strong problem-solving ability; recognize what you don’t know and find a path to know it

Preferences

  • Experience in the manufacturing industry

  • Previous Product Management Experience

  • Experience working in SaaS Companies

Benefits

  • Unlimited PTO, 2-week minimum

  • 401(k) plan

  • Health insurance (medical, vision, and dental)

  • Team outings, group lunches, an open office, happy hours

  • Flexible work schedule
